name: Fan Flower
climate: Fan Flower thrives in warm, temperate climates with mild winters and hot summers.
In tropical climates, Fan Flower can grow year-round as it favors heat and humidity.
It can tolerate coastal climates due to its tolerance to salty air and strong winds.
Subtropical regions provide an ideal environment for Fan Flower to flourish abundantly.
sunlight: Fan Flower grows best in full sun, requiring direct sunlight for several hours daily.
While it prefers full sun, Fan Flower can also adapt to partial shade conditions.
In areas of intense sun, some afternoon shade may help to prevent leaf scorching.
Ensure that Fan Flower receives a minimum of six hours of sunlight for best growth.
watering: Regular watering is essential for Fan Flower, especially in periods of dry weather.
Fan Flower should be watered deeply when the top couple of inches of soil are dry.
Over-watering can lead to root rot; hence, the soil must have good drainage properties.
During prolonged dry spells, additional watering may be necessary to keep it hydrated.
soil: Fan Flower prefers well-drained soil, preferably sandy or loamy, for optimal growth.
A soil pH close to neutral, ranging from 6.0 to 7.0, is ideal for Fan Flower cultivation.
In poor soil conditions, incorporating organic matter can improve nutrient availability.
Avoid overly rich soil as it can encourage foliage growth over blossom production.
extra_care_tip: Pruning Fan Flower encourages bushier growth and more prolific blooming.
To maintain health, regularly check for pests and treat with appropriate measures.
